english.segment1: I couldn't see beyond the corner to the stage. From my place between the cowboy and the clown. Mommy dressed me up and left me with a kiss. For the talent show now beginning. The curtain coming down. Just enough to hear them say,
english.segment2: Oh bravo. You're the best. There is no one else. Oh bravo. Our applause is not enough. Can you hear us yell out, yell out. On and on we go. Bravo
english.segment3: One by one they came and left us all amazed. Everyone so elegant. It made me feel so plain. The clown so colorful. The ballerina danced and twirled. And I thought, "Clearly they're all better than my little song!". And they deserve to hear the praise
english.segment4: Oh bravo. You're the best. There is no one else. Oh bravo. Our applause is not enough. Can you hear us yell out, yell out. On and on we go. Bravo
english.segment5: Running off the stage with bitter tears of shame. Close my eyes and try so hard to make it go away. I just want to go home and tell my teddy bear, "I failed, I failed!". I turned around the corner just to hear my daddy say,
english.segment6: Oh bravo. You're the best. You're my only one. Oh bravo. That will always be enough. Look at me. You're song was beautiful, beautiful. And even if nobody ever know. Bravo
